bulletin_message.00:
"Your wayfaring student of Geomancy has returned as a full-fledged Geomancer! They proved themselves an able practitioner of the magic arts indeed!"

"Here - these precious Hearthbud flowers coalesce traces of Hearth's magic into Hearth Essence, which Geomancers can use in their craft - be sure to tend to their planters."
The Rabbit Geomancer brought some Hearthbud, Hearth Essence, and raw materials along with them, to help start their new aboveground practice.

bulletin_message.00:
The goblin approaches, revealing itself a bit shorter than expected. "BONES! BONES!" They shout in a playful, almost childish voice.

"BOOOONEEES!" They continue.

It seems to be harmless.

Is that a child? Are there goblin children?

They're clearly happy about it, hopping around in circles. "BONES! BONES! MANY BONES!"

Suddenly, a stern and yet compassionate hearthling voice rumbles nearby. "There you are, Rattley!"

He wears the colors of the Northern Alliance. Strong and grizzled, he rests his hand on the head of the little goblin. "So there you are! Going out and making friends, eh?"

He notices the people around. "I apologize. Name's Thorulf, traveler and former Scout of the Library."

With a gentle pat the goblin goes back to jumping around.

"What?" he thunders. "No, don't call her a pet! She's a goblin - not a squirrel. They're people too, you know?"

He coughs, waving his hand as an apology.

"I apologize. It's just... We've been through a lot, Rattley and I." He looks on her direction as she plays with a small bone club. "Unfortunately not many places are prepared to accept or at least try to understand goblins..."

"Rattley is like a daughter to me." he says with a bittersweet smile "I am the reason she is alone in the world and she is the reason I left the Library. One watches over the other now!" he laughs, shoving away the past back where it belongs.

"I know you are busy so we'll go find a place to camp for some days!" He waves his hand, calling Rattley closer.

"Oh, I was almost forgetting..." he scratches the back of his head and smirks "I'll be busy setting up camp and won't have time to hunt so soon... Would you mind gifting little Rattley a couple of bones?"

The little goblin reacts to it. "BONES! GIVE BONES!"

Thorulf stares back at her "Rattley, what have I told you?".

She looks down "Please?"

Thorulf smiles "We would appreciate it, she loves carving them!"

"Good!" he exclaims, before turning around. "We'll be nearby. Stay warm!"

They start walking away.

bone_gift_quest.title: Bones for Rattley
bone_gift_quest.text: The little goblin loves carving things out of bone!

bulletin_message.00:
She quickly grabs the materials. "BONES! BONES!"

Behind her, Thorulf is finishing setting up the camp. "Rattley, thank them for the gift!"

She looks back before continuing. "BONES! You make Rattley happy!"

"Greetings once more, friends!" says the northerner as he puts a small bowl for feeding pets by your banner. "Rattley is showing herself to be a very promising bone carver!"

"BONES!" She seems very happy and grateful.

Thorulf seems very proud "We think you should have her latest creation."

Thorulf looks around, scratching his moustache "You folks from the southern lands are not used to carving bones."

He raises his brows, clearly having an idea "I'm teaching Rattley, one more apprentice wouldn't hurt. We'll go on a hunting trip soon and I can teach a Mason, if willing." he smiles "All I ask is some supplies for the days we'll be gone."

"AND BONES!" cheers Rattley.

"You welcome!" says Rattley with a smile.

Thorulf pats her on the head before continuing "She is a great apprentice. Bone carving is an art as ancient as the stars, very important to my people." he rests his hand over his own heart "Curiously enough it's also a tradition for the goblins."

Thorulf seems a bit disappointed.

"Well, I'm sure you know what is best for your people!" he smiles and takes a deep breath in "We'll go on our hunting trip and move on afterwards. We might come around here sometime soon if you wish to reconsider!"

He nods and turns around to leave as Rattley waves goodbye to everyone.

Thorulf rejoices "Hah, good! I knew you'd appreciate the invitation. It's hard to not appreciate intricate bone craftsmanship!"

"BONES!" cheers Rattley once more "BONE FRIEND!"

"We will head back to our camp, send your Mason our way whenever they're ready!"

Thorulf sighs. "Well, sometimes things just get in the way, eh?" he smiles "But I am sure we shall cross our paths again. Rattley surely wants to."

"BONE FRIEND!" she cheers.

"Maybe next time we're around we could even teach you a bit about bone carving! Well, off we go!"

hunting_trip_supplies_quest.title: Supplies for the trip
hunting_trip_supplies_quest.dialog_title: They'll need some food and some bones for Rattley.
hunting_trip_supplies_quest.text: And a bandage or two. Just for safety!

mason_dispatch_quest.text: Select a Mason (Level 2+) to learn Bone Carving with Thorulf and Rattley!
mason_dispatch_quest.title: Select a Mason

bulletin_message.00:
"BONES!" she cheers as she jumps around the town banner "We back, bone friend!"

Behind her, Thorulf and the Mason calmly approach while having a friendly conversation.

"There you go!" says Thorulf as they approach, he laughs "Your Mason is back safely, well fed and full of knowledge to share!"

Rattley silently approaches and holds on to the leg of her father, who continues "I'm afraid it is time to say goodbye, now. Hopefully this knowledge will serve you very well from now on."

He smiles. "May the stars always shine the brightest upon your town. Farewell!"

bone_recipes_unlock.bulletin_title: New Bone Carving recipes for the Mason!

bulletin_message.00:
"Many greetings! It seems our paths have crossed again." he smiles.

Rattley jumps in front of him "BONE FRIEND!"

They laugh and Thorulf continues "She insisted to come. We have a proposition!" he shows some of his own bone carved tools as he continues "We're going on another hunting trip nearby and maybe a Mason would be interested in learning bone carving?"

"Good to know you have interest!" he smiles, opening his arms wide "We can leave as soon as you're ready. But since we'll be out for a couple of days, some supplies wouldn't hurt... If that is alright!"

Rattley waves from behind his legs. "AND BONES!"

"And bones, of course!" he laughs.

"Oh, I understand." he gives a gentle yet disappointed smile.

"No bones?" Rattley sobs.

"Maybe next time, right? I'm sure they must be very busy. Sometimes this is just how things are!" he seems genuinely interested in teaching others, maybe someday he might return.

"We wish you the best of luck and may the stars always shine upon your town!"

bulletin_message.000: I am fading fast, but I have given the last of my spirit to this egg of the Great Dragon, so that the dragonling inside may finally hatch out into this world. I have known you for little time, Children of Monkey, but I trust you will aid this young whelp as you have aided me. May you carry yourselves with strength and compassion, as the Dragonborn once did.
